data.question: What is the empirical formula of NU-111?
At what temperature were the X-ray crystallography analyses of NU-111 conducted?
What is the crystal system of NU-111?
What method was used for the activation of NU-111?
What is the experimental BET surface area of NU-111 found to be?
What is the purpose of using helium in the calibration process for hydrogen adsorption measurements?
data.answer: To calculate the sample skeletal volume and the empty volumes, which are necessary for accurate hydrogen adsorption determination.

data.question: Why is the Feynman-Hibbs correction used in the simulations of H2 adsorption at 77 K?
data.answer: To account for quantum diffraction effects, which become important at low temperatures.

data.question: Is the space group of NU-111 Fm-3m?
Does the experimental BET surface area of NU-111 exceed 4900 m2/g?
Is the experimental pore volume of NU-111 less than 2.38 cm3/g?
Was the synthesis of NU-111 performed at a temperature of 100 °C?
Is the excess hydrogen uptake of NU-111 at 1 bar and 77 K greater than 20 mg/g?
Does NU-111 maintain its porosity after multiple cycles of high-pressure hydrogen adsorption at room temperature?
What is the yield of NU-111 after synthesis?
What is the maximum delivery pressure of hydrogen storage systems targeted by the U.S. Department of Energy for the year 2017?
What is the role of triple-bond spacers in the design of NU-111?
data.answer: To boost molecule-accessible gravimetric surface areas of MOFs.

data.question: Was NU-111 synthesized using a solvothermal reaction?
Is the linker used in the construction of NU-111 longer than the one used in NOTT-112?
Does the experimental BET surface area of NU-111 agree with the computationally simulated isotherm?
What is the experimental BET surface area of NU-111 compared to PCN-69/NOTT-119?
data.answer: NU-111 has a higher experimental BET surface area than PCN-69/NOTT-119.
